meanings.definition: A device used to store electric charge.
meanings.sent1: The capacitors in my phone help it stay charged.
meanings.sent2: I need to replace the capacitors in my computer.
meanings.sent3: Why did the smartphone break up with the capacitors? It couldn't handle the charge.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like capacitors, storing memories for later use.
meanings.sent5: The capacitors hummed softly, holding onto the electricity.

meanings.definition: An electronic component that consists of two conductive plates separated by an insulating material.
meanings.sent1: The capacitors in the circuit board regulate the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to discharge the capacitors before working on the device.
meanings.sent3: Why did the capacitor break up with the resistor? They couldn't bridge the gap.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as capacitors, keeping the conversation charged.
meanings.sent5: The capacitors stood like silent sentinels, guarding the flow of current.
